data.event: Some historians claim that the name was inspired by the building of the Panama Canal, but the town was already called Panama by 1898.
The site for the canal was not selected until 1902, so this claim seems unfounded.

event.title: 1896 the Kansas City, Pittsburg and Gulf Railroad (acquired

data.event: In 1896 the Kansas City, Pittsburg and Gulf Railroad (acquired by the Kansas City Southern Railway in 1900) built a north-south line through the region.
In 1896 the Kansas City, Pittsburg and Gulf Railroad (acquired by the Kansas City Southern Railway in 1900) built a north-south line through the region.
The Panama post office first opened January 14, 1898, but the order was rescinded for some unknown reason on February 23, 1898.

event.title: was rescinded for some unknown reason on February 23, 1898
